revisions.rev:
{{Use mdy dates|date=January 2011}} {{Infobox Artist Discography | Artist = [[Linkin Park]] | Image = LinkinParkBerlin2010.jpg | Caption = Linkin Park performing in Berlin in 2010 | Studio = 4 | Live = 3 | Video = 9 | Video link = Video albums | Option = 18 | Option name = Extended plays | Option color = #ffa07a | Singles = 23 | Music videos = 30 | 1Option = 2 | 1Option name = Remix albums | 1Option color = pink }} The [[discography]] of the American [[rock music|rock]] band [[Linkin Park]] consists of four [[studio album]]s, two [[remix album]]s, three [[live album]]s, eighteen [[extended play]]s (EPs), twenty-one [[single (music)|singles]], nine video albums and thirty [[music video]]s. Linkin Park was formed in [[Agoura Hills, California]] in 1996 by [[Mike Shinoda]] (vocals and guitars), [[Brad Delson]] (guitar) and [[Rob Bourdon]] (drums). [[Joe Hahn]] and Dave Farrell were later recruited, and in 1999 [[Chester Bennington]] became a member.{{cite web |url=http://www.lptimes.com/bio/bio_band.html |title=Linkin Park Biography |date=March 14, 2002 |accessdate=December 23, 2010 |publisher=[[Rolling Stone]] nÂ°891 |first=David |last=Fricke}}{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p447095|pure_url=yes}} |title=allmusic ((( Linkin Park > Overview ))) |work=[[Allmusic]] |first=MacKenzie |last=Wilson |publisher=[[All Media Guide]] |accessdate=October 28, 2008}} Linkin Park rose to international fame in 2000 with their debut album ''[[Hybrid Theory]]'', which peaked at number two on the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. It was the seventh best-selling album of the 2000s,{{cite web |url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20335406,00.html |title=Top Ten |publisher=[[Time Warner]] |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |date=December 28, 2009 |accessdate=December 25, 2010}} and certified Diamond in US and quadruple platinum in Europe.{{cite web|url=http://www.ifpi.org/content/section_news/plat2009.html |title=IFPI Platinum Europe Awards â 2009 |accessdate=December 25, 2010 |publisher=[[International Federation of the Phonographic Industry]]}} The fourth single from the album, "[[In the End]]", peaked at the second spot on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] (the highest of Linkin Park's career), and stayed on the chart for 38 weeks.{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/linkin-park/bio/411805#/song/linkin-park/in-the-end/2755594 |title=In the End â Linkin Park |accessdate=December 23, 2010 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media}} With first-week sales of 810,000,{{cite web |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1649068/20100930/linkin_park.jhtml |accessdate=December 23, 2010 |publisher=MTV. MTV Networks |title=Linkin Park's Chester Bennington Talks Album Sales, U.S. Tour |date=September 30, 2010 |first=James |last=Montgomery}} Linkin Park's second album ''[[Meteora (album)|Meteora]]'' (2003) entered the ''Billboard'' 200 at number one, becoming the third-best-selling album of the year.{{cite news|url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m0EIN/is_2003_Dec_31/ai_111776584/ |title=Nielsen SoundScan and Nielsen BDS 2003 Year End Music Industry Report |publisher=Business Wire/Find Articles |date= 2003â12â31|accessdate=August 6, 2009}} In 2007, their third studio album, ''[[Minutes to Midnight (album)|Minutes to Midnight]]'', also debuted at number-one on the ''Billboard'' 200, selling 623,000 copies in its first week.{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/news/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003589114#/bbcom/news/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003589114 |title= Linkin Park Scores Year's Best Debut With 'Midnight' |work=Billboard |accessdate=September 9, 2010 |publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]}} ''[[A Thousand Suns]]'' (2010) became the third straight Linkin Park studio album to debut at the top of the ''Billboard'' 200, but its first-week sales were less than half of its predecessorâ240,000 copies.{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/content_display/industry/news/e3i164dab495458bd2b80cd31a07fae1b7f |title=Linkin Park's 'A Thousand Suns' Tops Billboard 200|first=Keith |last=Caulfield |date=September 22, 2010 |accessdate=December 22, 2010 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5vB6wopix |archivedate=December 22, 2010 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media}} The band have also release two platinum-certified remix albumsâ''[[Reanimation]]'' (2002) and ''[[Collision Course (album)|Collision Course]]'' (2004)âthe latter a chart-topping collaboration with rapper [[Jay-Z]]. Linkin Park have sold over 50 million albums worldwide and have won two [[Grammy Awards]] for their singles "[[Crawling (song)|Crawling]]" and "[[Numb/Encore]]".{{cite news | first=Lisa | last=Verrico | coauthors= |authorlink= | title=Linkin Park | date=January 30, 2008 | work=[[The Times]] |publisher=[[News Corporation]] | url =http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/music/live_reviews/article3271745.ece | accessdate =September 9, 2010 }}{{cite web |url=http://www2.grammy.com/GRAMMY_Awards/Winners/Results.aspx?title=&winner=Linkin_Park&year=0&genreID=0&hp=1 |title=Grammy Awards: Best Hard Rock Performance |accessdate=September 9, 2010 |publisher=[[National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences]]}} The band has produced ten number-one singles on ''Billboard''{{'}}s [[Alternative Songs]] chart,{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/column/chartbeat/linkin-park-leaps-to-no-1-on-alternative-1004111062.story#/column/chartbeat/linkin-park-leaps-to-no-1-on-alternative-1004111062.story |title=Linkin Park Leaps To No. 1 On Alternative Songs |first=Gary |last=Trust |date=August 25, 2010 |accessdate=December 23, 2010 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media}} and is the second-ever act to have at least ten weeks with three or more tracks on that chart.{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/column/chartbeat/chart-beat-wednesday-linkin-park-eagles-1004004746.story#/column/chartbeat/chart-beat-wednesday-linkin-park-eagles-1004004746.story |accessdate=December 23, 2010 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |date=August 19, 2009 |first=Gary |last=Trust |title=Chart Beat Wednesday: Linkin Park, Eagles, Shakira}} Linkin Park Underground, the band's official fan club, annually releases EPs with rare tracks, demos, live recordings and remixes.{{cite web |url=http://lpu.linkinpark.com/ |title=Linkin Park Underground |publisher=linkinpark.com |accessdate=January 3, 2011}} ==Albums== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !rowspan="2" style="width:30px;"| Year !rowspan="2" style="width:270px;"| Album details
